attributes.action: ensure that the general public can vote or influence a decision online, put those decisions made by local councils and goverment online and accessible to the general public to vote on
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: I would suggest that most of the UK adult population now has access to the internet and although I have seen much online advancement I feel we are at the stage when we can do a lot more. I refer to local councils and the decisions that seem to be made in our absence; decisions such as building applications and other item that you are allowed to have a say on but because it is buried in the town hall rarely notice until they have been implemented. I propose that the government look into on my behalf the best way to make anything that can be which is handled by local government, online, accessible and ‘votable’ on by the general public. We should be able to vote online and make objections known online at the technological  stage which we are at and that’s what this petition is about, anyone agree? Thanks for reading.
